perturbation.original_text: Developer will design, develop, and deliver, satisfactory to Client, the "Pelican Delivers Application Phase 1" (collectively, the Subject Program), and all elated Project services (collectively, the Services), Project work product (collectively, the Deliverables), and user manuals and other written material that describe he functionality or assist in the use of the Subject Program (collectively, the Documentation), pursuant to the Project specifications detailed in the SO (collectively, Specifications), as described in the enclosed statement of work (the SOW; as provided in APPENDIX A hereto).
perturbation.changed_text: Service Provider will design, develop, and deliver, satisfactory to Customer, the "Pelican Delivers Application Phase 1" (collectively, the Subject Program), and all elated Project services (collectively, the Services), Project work product (collectively, the Deliverables), and user manuals and other written material that describe he functionality or assist in the use of the Subject Program (collectively, the Documentation), pursuant to the Project specifications detailed in the SO (collectively, Specifications), as described in the enclosed statement of work (the SOW; as provided in APPENDIX A hereto).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Developer' to 'Service Provider' and 'Client' to 'Customer' without explicitly defining them as interchangeable creates ambiguity.  It's now unclear if 'Service Provider' and 'Customer' are indeed the same entities as 'Developer' and 'Client', potentially leading to confusion about which party is responsible for which obligations.

perturbation.original_text: Each SOW will include a delivery schedule for Services and Deliverables (the Delivery Schedule) that will identify mutual agreed upon Project time deadlines concerning the performance of Services, delivery of Deliverables, Client testing of the same (collectively, Milestones), as well as a final Subject Program delivery date (Final Delivery Date).
perturbation.changed_text: Each SOW will include a delivery schedule for Services and Deliverables (the Project Timeline) that will identify mutual agreed upon Project time deadlines concerning the performance of Services, delivery of Deliverables, Customer assessment of the same (collectively, Benchmarks), as well as a final Subject Program delivery date (Completion Target).
perturbation.explanation: Substituting 'Delivery Schedule' with 'Project Timeline', 'Client testing' with 'Customer assessment', 'Milestones' with 'Benchmarks', and 'Final Delivery Date' with 'Completion Target' introduces different terms for the same concept without explicitly stating the equivalence. This creates ambiguity and uncertainty, as it's not clear if the obligations tied to the original terms still apply to the new terms.

perturbation.original_text: The Client and the Designer both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging comments Online regarding any of the Designer's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such persons. For purposes of this Section, "disparage" shall mean any negative statement whether written or oral, about Seattle Software Developers, Inc., Dot Com LLC. and or any of its affiliates.
perturbation.changed_text: The Customer and the Creator both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging comments Online regarding any of the Creator's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such persons. For purposes of this Section, "disparage" shall mean any negative statement whether written or oral, about Seattle Software Developers, Inc., Dot Com LLC. and or any of its affiliates.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'Client' with 'Customer' and 'Designer' with 'Creator' without clearly establishing their equivalence with the original terms, particularly 'Developer,' adds to the ambiguity. It's unclear whether the non-disparagement clause applies to these new entities, potentially leading to disputes about who is covered by this provision and whether the original parties' obligations extend to these new terms.
